meanings.definition: To make a deep, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The thunder boomed loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The cannon boomed across the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The old drum boomed a surprise beat, making everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: His voice boomed like a powerful speaker, commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The music boomed through the concert hall, filling it with energy.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or importance.
meanings.sent1: The population of the city boomed after the new factory opened.
meanings.sent2: The technology industry boomed in the last decade.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter unexpectedly boomed in the oven, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her career boomed like a rocket, reaching new heights quickly.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks boomed in popularity, lighting up the sky with colors.

meanings.sent1: The boom of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The distant boom of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The boom of the fireworks startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The deep boom of the gong marked the beginning of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The boom of the bass guitar added a powerful rhythm to the music.
